intro: Indigofera acanthoclada, commonly known as the thorned indigo, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are typically pale blue or white, clustered in racemes, and are accompanied by small, hairy pods. Indigofera acanthoclada is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
